hero_subtitle: Explore how Blackpool Council spends public money. As a unitary authority with a £1.2 billion annual budget, Blackpool manages all local services — from social care and education to housing and waste — serving 141,000 residents on the Fylde Coast.
publisher_bio: This website was created by Tom Pickup, County Councillor for Padiham & Burnley West and Clowbridge with Dunnockshaw. Formerly part of the Reform UK internal DOGE team and former Lead Member for Finance & Resources at Lancashire County Council, Tom builds transparency tools to make public spending data accessible across Lancashire.
publisher_titles: County Councillor for Padiham & Burnley West
County Councillor for Clowbridge with Dunnockshaw
publisher_quote: It's your money. The more people understand where it goes, the better.

doge_context.political_control: Labour majority. Leader: Cllr Lynn Williams.
